title: More Viktor nerfs? Why?
body:
"Base damage lowered to 70/110/150/190/230 from 70/115/160/205/250, augment explosion damage lowered to 70/110/150/190/230 from 70/115/160/205/250"

What are the justifications for this nerf? Viktor is in no way shape or form a broken or overpowered champion. He has clear strengths and weaknesses with pretty clear counterplay. Hell, even his winrate hasn't been spectacular for a long amount of time either, 47.25% winrate overall, capping out at a clear 50% on average on players with more than 125 games on him. (http://champion.gg/champion/Viktor/Middle)

So is it because he is constantly picked in pro play? Well he gets picked because of his ability to clear waves, which is really desirable because of what YOU have implemented into this game, Riot. YOU made turrets standing butter bars that need to be protected or you lose too much. 

So yes, they're nerfing him for his waveclear. But Ahri on the other hand got a buff to her Q a while back to "help her clear waves" despite the fact that her wave clear also deals true damage. And that Ahri has been sitting on a much more comfortable spot than Viktor ever has, for a much longer time as well. 53% win rate which increases to 56% once you have 125 games on her. But then I forget the balance team likes to play favorites.

It is relevant. The magic damage component does 20% more damage when you get abyssal. The true-damage ends up weaker for wave-clear. :^)

Some are saying because his waveclear and sieging with Deathray are exceptional alongside super cost-effective once his E is upgraded. These advantages allow him to create extraordinary siege comps...but he still isn't winning as much as Lux/Zed/Ahri. The siege capability is also his greatest strength right now, so why they're nerfing that without compensation on top of how strong his current competition is baffling. 

He's picked a lot in Korea (at most 18%), even if his winrate is subpar (45-48%). That said, OP.GG has some odd discrepancies at the moment, so I'm not even sure how reliable those stats are. 

[I made another thread earlier that's been in flux for a bit, if you want to see it for reference.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/qZEfI0aJ-riot-i-know-its-only-tentative-but-care-to-explain-the-viktor-nerfs)

I don't care how Riot's sees our concerns, but I really want some clarification here. What I don't understand is why they nerfed both the base damage and the augment damage when they could have simply made the Augment damage deal less to minions.
"Hey we got this mid range burst mage here! lets nerf his burst, that should be a great idea!"

As a (semi) Viktor main, I don't see the justification for Viktor's nerfs here.

Even though I was originally against Riot making his Hex Cores be scaling instead of flat AP and mana, I learned to get used to it by not rushing Perfect Hex Core. But nerfing his E? Why?

It's bad enough that Viktor's counters (Zed, Talon, etc.) are super meta now because of Riot's genius decision to create Duskblade of Draktharr, but now Viktor's waveclear is being nerfed?

Whatever the balance team is smoking right now, I'd like some of it.

Ahri has to use 2 Qs to clear wave, when when you are ahead, your 1 Q will not clear melee minions.
Viktor was able to clear both melee and caster minions in 1 second. He was probably the best wave clear in LoL.
That's regarding your Ahri comparison.

On the other hand, I don't see why he had to be nerfed. I mean, sure. He has burst and a shield and wave clear and a slow/stun zone control, but that's about it.
If anything, the wave clear is the core of his identity right now (game play identity), and that's the reason why you pick Viktor over other mages. If they were thinking he is way to strong, they could've removed that shield of his for example......... not the darn wave clear.

Then you get 4 months later:
Immobile mages do not have an identity and there's no reason to pick one over another one.
Gee rito, guess who's fault that is........

Viktor cant clear the melee minions with just one E though. At the very least you need to throw an AA at each of the melees to kill them with E. And lets not forget that his E costs a lot more than an Ahri Q and is a far higher concentration of his potential damage output than her Q.

So all the lcs viktors 1 shotting waves were just imagination? 
Do you want video proof?
Yes, actually, that would be nice.

http://www.lolesports.com/en_PL/na-lcs/na_2016_spring/matches/regular_season/CLG-vs-C9
minute 20+ in game, that's ~33 in the video

So yea, like I said, needs an AA on each of the melee minions for clear it with his E. I can admit that that might be a bit strong, but honestly Viktors E constitutes a MASSIVE portion of his damage outputs "power budget", if you will. If he uses his E to clear a wave, you have upwards of 6-7 seconds (without CDR, iirc) where Viktors potential damage in a fight is going to be almost laughable because of how reliant he is on that ability for damage.

And honestly, Viktor is hardly the biggest culprit in this regard as well. Lux, who might not see much play in the LCS (correct me if im wrong) but is an extremely strong mid lane pick in non-professional play, can use her own E to clear a wave just as easily (easier, actually, considering its ridiculous range) while at the same time having higher poke potential on her lane opponent because of its area of effect.

http://www.lolesports.com/en_PL/eu-lcs/eu_2016_spring/matches/regular_season/ROC-vs-EL
33 minutes in video, she ult+e to clear casters and melee
her E alone doesn't even clear casters :( Then again, its Abysal Rush :(
point in case ~37.10 minutes in the game, her E again doesn't even kill casters

The reason why Lux was rarely played before despite being a long range mage (like Xerath and Ziggs when they were meta) because she was dependent on blue buff (cdr) and ultimate (dmg) from wave clear. 
She was meta for a while since she could burst down a squishy very very fast, and {{item:3092}} helped her slow the target to hit the burst combo.
41.30-41.55 on the video, (albeit this was done without frost queens slow).
42.40-42.50 you can still see her e can't 1 shot casters.
~43mins you can see how lux actually clears waves "demacia"
~59 minutes in, she still can't 1 shot caster minions with her E. Despite having {{item:3089}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3001}} {{item:3092}} {{item:1058}} . And that's an AP lux, not a CDR one. 

So, Lux wave clear ain't that good.
Anyway, Lux is strong because {{item:3092}} makes it easier to land your Qs. And 45% CDR build means your ult is up every 35 seconds or so.
She is played in LCS rarely, this year due to again, frostqueens making her life easier.

While she cant full clear the wave with just her E, she can get them low enough that the purchase of {{item:3285}} would allow her(in conjunction with her Q) to, the same as Viktor. I guess Vik can clear more of the wave, but at the end of the day neither of them can actually full clear a wave without Ludens. However, the key point (in terms of organized play, at least) is that they can both clear/get the wave low enough that their teammates can then facilitate the clearing of whats left easily enough.

So (imo, at least) the question still remains as to why Vik is getting hit with the nerf bat while champions with similar capabilities, that excel in other areas above Vik, are remaining unchanged.

Lux can't even clear caster minions normally. So, even if you build {{item:3285}} 
Melees will survive just fine, since Echo's aoe damage is random, even caster minions might survive (Echo does splash damage on 3 targets, total enemies in a wave: 6).

Anyway, I do agree that the nerf bat on Viktor is stupid right now.
Maybe they thing he will get a HUGE buff with mage rework from items/mastery (like ashe was preemptively nerfed before Warrior Bloodlust hit in pre6). But otherwise, I don't see any point in that nerf.
Then again, if we would be to question the balance team:
Why does Fiora get % max hp true damage?
Why does Graves have to kite monsters in the jungle so easy?
Was Xin buff necessary?
5% nerf on Zed's ult means as little as 5AD buff on Warrior due to the new item, what's up with that?
and more :(
sadly, they are beyond us

This is completely mind blowing to me. Like, its almost impossible for me to even remotely wrap my mind around their strategy with this game right now. I cant think of any other multiplayer game that has so blatantly and ham-fistedly pushed their own agenda onto their players, including riot themselves in the past. Since the end of S5 they have been shoving mages farther and farther to the back of the bus, while continuing to pander to AD champions exclusively over and over again. Talon and Zed were already strong before {{item:3147}} , and now theyre just going to be borderline overpowered. Graves and Quinn were already borderline overpowered after the ADC update, and now with {{item:3147}} are going to be perma pick/ban im sure. 

I mean jesus, they even just gave Ekko some love and he's still got one of the most overloaded kits in the game(imo). Yet Viktor, a champion I cant even recall ever being on the boards' shit list, a champion who has never really had a spectacular win rate as far as im aware, is getting nerfed with no compensation?

What in the actual fuck is riot doing with this game?
Every time there is a balanced focused patch I wonder why I'm still playing this game.
